results.title: Tone, Touch and Technique for the Advanced Pianist
results.brief_description: Max Cooke brings to life the theories of posture, gesture and co-ordination, which lead to ease and beauty in piano playing.

results.title: Tone poem: moods in the forest
results.creator_credit: African Film Productions and South Africa Railways
results.brief_description: A short colonial film that contrasts a woman collecting flowers in a dense South African forest with men logging the forest around her. The images are complimented by a musical arrangement by Michael Dorre conducting the Johannesburg Colosseum Symphony Orchestra. The film concludes with a title “Thus the sun illumined forests of the Cape”

results.title: Tomorrow: the thinking machine
results.creator_credit: CBS Television, Thomas Wolf, Rene Bras and Nicholas Webster
results.brief_description: A report on the only two known objects in the universe that seem capable of reasoning - the human brain and the electronic computer. Leading scientists display a computer that seems to learn as a child learns, writes a television play and plays draughts - and wins.

results.title: Tomorrow winter comes
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet, Francois Seguillon and Therese Dumesnil
results.brief_description: More and more skiers are opting for cross-country skiing rather than schussing down the crowded, and costlier, maintained slopes. This film captures the full pleasure and delight of this more relaxed but equally invigorating winter sport. A small group of skiers is observed on a day’s outing and, as they glide along through quiet Laurentian woodlands, the film notes techniques of movement. Tips are also given on proper clothing and on ski maintenance. In French with English subtitles. (Award: La Baule.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet, Francois Seguillon and Therese Dumesnil

results.title: Tomorrow is today
results.brief_description: Tells of the expanding needs of an increasing population; discusses the stresses and strains of youth and the responsibility of leadership as education, science and industry move ahead. Describes the advantages that scouting offers to a community.

results.title: Tomorrow is ours
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India and Jehangir Bhownagary
results.brief_description: The speaker was a “displaced person” who had lived for eight years with a village in India; he is meeting with the head villagers to explain what had been done in the 1951 first Five Year Plan that was now ending, of the path at “free” India was leading the people on, and the forthcoming Five Year Plan.

results.title: Tomorrow is now
results.brief_description: The work of the Post Office research laboratories in Melbourne in a brief coverage of six of the many current research projects. These are: testing of telephones, operation of the time and frequency standard, the effect and control of plume radiation on aerial systems, microwave propagation testing, experiments with optical fibres and trials conducted with a computer controlled exchange.
